page.title: 03The Wheel Craft Centre
page.content:
Over 50 years ago there were two working mills in Chudleigh, the Wheel and Palace Mills where farmers took their own grain for milling. The Wheel has been converted into The Wheel Craft Workshops and has a working water wheel, and historic mill buildings which house a restaurant and craft workshops. The mill was mentioned in the Domesday book and was one of many mills involved in Chudleigh's woollen industry. The waterwheel is one of the largest working backshot wheels in the country and has extensive interior machinery. The centre is open from 10 to 5.30 seven days a week all year and the restaurant is also open evenings.
The Wheel Craft Workshops, Town Mills, Clifford Street, Chudleigh (signposted from centre of Chudleigh on A38 road)
